value.title: An overview of Azure Integration Services | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure Integration Services brings together API Management, Logic Apps, Service Bus, and Event Grid as a reliable, scalable platform for integrating on-premises and cloud-based applications, data, and processes across your enterprise. [04:41] Demo Start   Azure Integration Services overview https://aka.ms/azfr/527/01
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sbqhJsWhKAs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure AD Managed Service Identity | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Arturo Lucatero joins Donovan Brown to discuss Azure AD Managed Service Identity, which can be used to authenticate to any service that supports Azure AD authentication. For more information, see: What is Managed Service Identity (MSI) for Azure resources? (docs): https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/managed-service-identity/overview
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bBi1bll2928" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Automation | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jenny Hunter joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Automation, which has seen several new improvements including support for Python 2, the ability to run against local Linux machines, the ability to run against any Azure VM with no setup (Run Command), and native Azure alert integration. [03:27] Demo

value.title: Azure Container Instances (ACI) under the hood | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Have you ever wondered what's going on under the hood for serverless offerings like Azure Container Instances? MacKenzie Olson shows Scott Hanselman the latest innovations in the infrastructure that powers ACI and a peek at the product roadmap, including a demo of the managed identity experience coming

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Availability Zones
value.excerpt: Raj Ganapathy joins Scott Hanselman to discuss the new addition to Azure's resiliency offerings â€“ Availability Zones. Azure Availability Zones are fault-isolated locations within an Azure region to help protect customers applications and data from datacenter-level failures with independent power, network,

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Backup
value.excerpt: Even though Azure takes three copies of your virtual machines and stores them in Azure Storage, you still need to protect your data against ransomware, corruption, or accidental deletion. Kelly Anderson stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman about how simple it is to set up Azure Backup, how its built-in

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Olivier Bloch joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure IoT and how it is more than just about connecting IoT devices and sending telemetry to the Cloud. They also talk about Azure IoT device topics such as twins, provisioning, and lifecycle management.  For more information, see:  Azure IoT Hub - http://aka.ms/azureiotgetstarted

value.title: Azure Friday | Visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra shows Donovan Brown how you can now visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2 and be more productive by getting pipelines up & running quickly without writing any code. value.title: Azure Reserved VM Instances (RIs) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Yashesvi Sharma joins Scott Hanselman to discuss how to significantly reduce costs up to 72 percent compared to pay-as-you-go prices with one-year or three-year terms on Windows and Linux virtual machines (VMs). When you combine the cost savings gained from Azure RIs with the added value of the Azure

value.title: Azure Security Center | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kelly Anderson joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Security Center, which offers built-in security management and threat protection for your cloud workloads. Azure Security Center helps you find & fix vulnerabilities, aids in blocking malicious access and alerts you when your resources are under attack.

value.title: Azure Security Center â€“ Just-in-Time Network Access
value.excerpt: Cloud hosted VMâ€™s are prime targets for RDP and SSH brute force attacks because management ports are typically left in an open state. With Just in Time network access, you can put any of your ports, not just management ports, into a default deny state until a user requires access. Once access is requested,

value.title: Best practices for Azure Container Instances (ACI) with GitHub Actions | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure Container Instances (ACI) allow for a quick, simple, and cost effective way to run serverless containers in production. ACI is generally available and is for hosting serverless containerized workloads, including ETL pipelines, serverless batch jobs, and API microservices. Come hang out with Scott

value.title: Best way to start Power Apps for a non-professional developer? | One Dev Question: Dona Sarkar
value.excerpt: Sometimes services like Power Apps can be daunting. In the One Dev Question series, Principal Cloud Advocate Dona Sarkar shares some tips for getting started and explains why you do not have to be a professional developer to use Power Apps.   For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/modules/get-started-with-powerapps/?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-donasa

value.title: Code to Cloud with Docker and Azure Container Instances | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Chad Metcalf from Docker joins Scott Hanselman to show how to use the Docker CLI to deploy a container to Azure Container Instances (ACI). Using only the Docker CLI, Chad deploys a Minecraft image to ACI and then shares the public IP address with Scott so he can join in the wacky, blocky world!  ACI

value.excerpt: Data integration is complex and has many moving parts that spans across hybrid data environments. value.title: Deploy your Web App in Windows Containers on Azure App Service | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Windows Container support is available in preview in Azure App Service. value.title: Event-based data integration with Azure Data Factory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Event-driven architecture (EDA), which is a common data integration pattern that involves production, detection, consumption, and reaction to events. Learn how you can do event-based data integration using Azure Data Factory. [01:53] Demo Start   For more

value.title: Execute Jars and Python scripts on Azure Databricks using Data Factory | Azure Friday

value.title: Full-stack end-to-end monitoring with Azure Monitor | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Rahul Bagaria joins Lara Rubbelke to discuss Azure Monitor, which now includes Log Analytics and Application Insights. Azure Monitor provides full stack monitoring tools for collecting and analyzing telemetry that allow you to maximize the performance and availability of your cloud and on-premises resources

value.excerpt: Working with Apache Kafka and want to simplify management of your infrastructure? Lena Hall joins Scott Hanselman to show you can keep using Apache Kafka libraries for hundreds of projects, and try Azure Event Hubs behind the scenes to focus on code instead of maintaining infrastructure.  4:44 - Demo

value.excerpt: In workbooks, you can build complex reports but may need a way to segment information in different sections.
